title: Galactosemia: Hereditary Disorder of Carbohydrate Metabolism
short_description: Clinical overview of galactosemia, a rare genetic disorder affecting galactose metabolism that requires early diagnosis and dietary intervention to prevent severe complications.
long_description: This document provides a comprehensive overview of galactosemia, a rare autosomal recessive hereditary disorder that impairs the body's ability to convert galactose to glucose due to deficiency of the enzyme galactose-1-phosphate uridylyl transferase (GALT). The document explains the critical importance of early diagnosis and immediate implementation of a lactose-restricted, dairy-free diet to prevent life-threatening complications including profound intellectual disability, liver failure, and death in newborns. It distinguishes between classic galactosemia and clinical variant forms that require treatment, versus the Duarte biochemical variant that does not typically cause clinical disease from lactose consumption.
